text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with my new york city Hellmann's
club sandwich experience now i'm
assuming you've checked out the blog so
you know the heck i'm talking about if
you haven't please go check it out
but anyway here we go the event was
hosted in New York City I was put up at
the lovely Intercontinental Hotel the
event was held at this really cool
warehouse which was kind of in a
neighborhood sandwiched in between
Chelsea and Hell's Kitchen we went in a
place called la or lai venue which was
all set up for our demonstration alright
so there's the demo table we had camera
people we had bloggers photographing
things that's Karen from Rock and Mama
and there you see our sandwich making
stations where we would be sent after
chef flay's demo to make our own a
signature sandwich and oh yeah
we had plenty of mayonnaise so after a
little bit of mingling and milling about
the demo started it was time for chef
bobby flay
to come up and show us his take on three
classic sandwiches all right we have the
turkey Cuban the turkey Reuben a famous
New York sandwich of course and then the
chicken muffuletta made famous in New
Orleans now I believe Hellmann's had
someone filming the entire demo which I
will show you as soon as possible but
chef flay came up he made all three
sandwiches and gave some great sandwich
making tips like make sure you spread
both pieces of bread with the Mayo or
the condiment and of course after the
demo they had prepared all three
sandwiches he had made theirs the Reuben
in front of the New York backdrop
there's the Cuban sandwich in front of
the what I believe is a Miami backdrop
and the New Orleans sandwich no picture
too blurry hey I'm a chef not a
photographer so after a little bit of
gnashing we went over to get our
sandwich making materials they had a
nice spread with a bunch of cool
ingredients luckily all of these are
good on sandwiches so that worked out so
all the bloggers went through they
picked anything they wanted to construct
their signature sandwiches here are some
of them working away here's me giving
one of my station mates a little
friendly advice now you realize you will
be asked
when we were done chef flay walked
around and critiqued our sandwiches and
answered questions and then it was my
turn so I decided to go with marble rye
one of my favorite sandwich breads of
all time and Here I am demonstrating my
advanced mayonnaise spreading technique
and like with almost everything else in
life it's all in the wrist so I decided
to try something I had never made before
it was Munster ham cucumber and hot
sweet banana peppers which ended up
being a very very interesting
combination the bitterness from the
cucumber I thought really brought out
the sweetness in the ham and the peppers
I decided to call it the mitts of flava
JH which is about the worst sandwich
name since the grinder horrible name
notwithstanding it was a really nice
sandwich chef Flay showed us a really
cool cutting technique and I'm going to
show you in an upcoming video and I know
what you're thinking there's a trick to
cutting a sandwich yes there is and
here's the chef and I discussing my
sandwich I think at this point I was
telling him how awesome it was I think
he was agreeing with me in fact he said
quote it looks like a professional made
it which is probably the nicest thing an
Iron Chef has ever said to me so all in
all a very fun experience in New York at
club sandwich
thank you to Hellmann's stay tuned for
more how to build a perfect sandwich
pose upcoming and as I always enjoy and
Spidey take us out buddy
